title: NOPD: 3-year-old boy shot, brought to grocery store
content:
NEW ORLEANS -- The New Orleans Police Department is investigating the shooting of a 3-year-old child on the Westbank, and a 23-year-old man is facing charges, according to the New Orleans Police Department.
Lesean Rozumialski was booked with second degree cruelty to a juvenile, cruelty to a juvenile and aggravated battery.
Around 8:30 p.m. Tuesday in the 300 block of Huntlee Dr. initially police said a man was cleaning his firearm when the gun discharged, striking the little boy. Later, Rozumialski "told police he was in the living room of the home when he stood up, threw his gun on the table and proceeded to walk into the kitchen," said a statement from the NOPD.
Officers said the child was driven to a nearby store where a deputy was working, and police and EMS were called. Investigators say the child was brought to the hospital and went into surgery. His condition was unknown as of 11 p.m. Tuesday.
If you have any information that could help investigators, you're asked to call Crimestoppers at 822-1111.
